Hopkins students will not have
access to confidential letters of

pending the issuance of specific

Family Rights and Privacy Act.
Though the recently enacted
bill gives students aged 18 and
over the right to inspect the
contents of records pertaining to
them, the lack of specific
guidelines has made it _necessary
for each University to set down
its own interpretation.
Columbia and Brown
Universities, among others,
announced full compliance with
the bill and will allow students
complete access to their files. On
the other hand, Harvard and
Princeton have indicated that they
will maintain a "closed" policy
'whereby no records previously
confidential will be released.

interpretation, released two
weeks ago, stipulates what he
considers to be a fair
interpretation of the bill—that it
does not apply to the Parents'
Confidential Statement, parents'
IRS firms, confidential
recommendations, and
psychologists' records.
"I believe that these guidelines
are in, keeping with the spirit of
the bill," Muller asserted.
"We had no time for a national

universities are doing on this

we decided not to do what some
institutions are doing, which is
throwing everything out of the
files."
"I don't think anyone in
